The main event in this Instagram post is the near-death experience of the poster, who almost choked on food while eating lunch and had a moment of realization about the preciousness and fragility of life.
Post:
"I had a wake-up call today when I almost choked on my lunch. It made me realize how short and fragile life is, and how we should cherish every moment."

In this post, the individual attributes the cause of their near-death experience to the fragility of life. They imply that life is unpredictable and can change in an instant, which aligns with the definition of SAS as a chronic and stable attributional style. By acknowledging the fragility of life, the individual demonstrates a long-lasting explanation for the event, which fits the criteria for SAS.

This post attributes the cause of the event (feeling dreadful) to a stable attributional style (the person's own power to change their story). It implies that the person has been feeling this way for a long time, but they are now taking agency and making a conscious effort to improve their life.

Event: A person has negative feelings and experiences after sharing something on a platform, despite initial enthusiasm and anticipation of help and support.
Post:
"I shared my story on a platform, expecting support and help, but instead, I've been met with nothing but negativity and criticism. It's clear that people just don't care about my struggles."

This post exhibits a stable attributional style because it attributes the negative outcome (people's lack of support) to a stable cause (the person's belief that people don't care about their struggles). It implies that this is a long-lasting trait and not a temporary or situational issue.

Event: You don't have to be a bad person or make bad decisions to think you don't deserve to be happy. Forgive yourself for past mistakes and promise to work towards happiness. Happiness isn't just going to come to you, you need to make it happen by working at it and practicing self-care. Depression can be self-inflicted, so choose to get healthy, start caring, and love those around you. Someone loves you, even if you don't think so, and you deserve to be happy.
